intro: Pseudoclausia hispida, commonly known as the rough pseudoclausia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a rough texture. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
